title: The Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is one for the ages
description: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Wimbledon champs Swiatek at No. 3, Sinner No. 1
description: Wimbledon champ Iga Swiatek jumped up to the No. 3 WTA rankings and runner-up, Amanda Anisimova, broke into the top 10 for the first time at No. 7. On the men's side, Jannik Sinner remains No. 1. Semifinalist Taylor Fritz bumped up to No. 4.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: From drugs bans to Wimbledon champions - how did we get here?
description: Iga Swiatek and Jannik Sinner have won the Wimbledon singles titles having served drugs bans within the past year. Dan Roan explores what it means for tennis.

title: 'A gift to our sport' - why Sinner-Alcaraz rivalry is something to cherish
description: Tennis always needs great rivalries - Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz are developing one that looks like running for years to come.

title: Watch Challenger TV: #NextGenATP stars Prizmic, Blockx & Cina in action
description: The ATP Challenger Tour is your home to watch the sport‚Äôs future stars, today. Lately, #NextGenATP standouts Dino Prizmic, Alexander Blockx and Federico Cina are among those who have been making a splash on the Challenger Tour and improving their position in the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah. To follow their journeys, fans can tune into Challenger TV to stream all ATP Challenger Tour matches live and on demand at no cost.Prizmic and Cina are in action this week at the Internazionali di Tennis San Marino Open, where 17-year-old Justin Engel is also competing. Prizmic, 19, went on a 14-match winning streak from May to July, claiming two Challenger titles in that span followed by a runner-up finish. The Croatian is fourth in the Race To Jeddah, behind Jakub Mensik, Joao Fonseca and Learner Tien. Blockx is seeded second at the Les Championnats Banque Nationale de Granby in Canada, with American Eliot Spizzirri leading the field. Blockx, a two-time Challenger champion, last week contested his third final at that level in Winnipeg, only falling to Canadian Liam Draxl. Denmark‚Äôs August Holmgren, who turned heads by reaching the third round of Wimbledon as a qualifier, is competing in Granby. Last week, #NextGenATP Croatia‚Äôs Matej Dodig claimed his maiden Challenger Tour trophy in Trieste. The 19-year-old, who is 13th in the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah, is playing this week at the Dutch Open Tournament in Bunschoten. View the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah Standings Prizmic, Blockx, Cina and Dodig are all seeking their maiden trips to the 20-and-under Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF, held in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia from 17-21 December. The Open Ciudad de Pozoblanco is also taking place this week, with Frenchman Hugo Grenier spearheading the field. American 17-year-old Darwin Blanch is among the #NextGenATP players in the draw. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Darderi swings from ‚Äòa little bit crazy‚Äô to Bastad debut win
description: Luciano Darderi rode a Nordea Open rollercoaster on Monday afternoon in Bastad, but the Italian ultimately held firm for a three-set debut victory at the clay ATP 250. The sixth-seeded Darderi prevailed 6-2, 2-6, 6-2 against Raphael Collignon to advance and set a second-round meeting with Tristan Boyer or Elias Ymer by the Swedish seaside. In his maiden Lexus ATP Head2Head clash with Collignon, Darderi steadied himself after a second-set lapse to seal a two-hour, 10-minute win. ‚ÄúI have to say congratulations to Raphael. He played the second set amazingly,‚Äù said the No. 55 in the PIF ATP Rankings in his on-court interview. ‚ÄúI went a little bit crazy in some games but then in the third set I came back again. I think mentality was the key to the third set.‚Äù Off and running in Bastad üëáDe Jong d. Rejchtman Vinciguerra 6-3 6-2Darderi d. Collignon 6-2 2-6 6-2@NordeaOpen | #NordeaOpen pic.twitter.com/MzQpUuEgcs‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) July 14, 2025 Darderi crucially saved two break points from 2-2, 15/40 in the decider and he finished the match having saved six of eight break points he faced overall, according to Infosys ATP Stats. The 23-year-old lifted his second ATP Tour title in April in Marrakech. In the only other main-draw singles match on Monday‚Äôs schedule, Jesper de Jong carved a more straightforward path to the second round. The Dutchman downed home #NextGenATP wild card William Rejchtman Vinciguerra 6-3, 6-2. De Jong will face eighth seed Vit Kopriva or Hugo Dellien next. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Sinner Wins Maiden Wimbledon Title
description: Jannik Sinner exacted his revenge on Carlos Alcaraz on Sunday, defeating the two-time defending champion 4-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 in the Wimbledon final to capture his fourth major and become the first Italian man to win the singles crown. The world No. 1, who fell to Alcaraz in a five-hour, 29-minute Roland Garros epic last ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Twelve Recap
description: Wimbledon‚Äôs final weekend is set, and it‚Äôs the showdown everyone hoped for. Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will meet in the 2025 men‚Äôs final after both came through their semi-finals on Day Twelve, though in very different ways. Sinner produced a near-flawless performance to dispatch a hampered Novak Djokovic in straight sets, reaching his first ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
